intro: Cissus chrysadenia, commonly known as the golden cissus, is a climbing plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Vitaceae and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and ability to climb using tendrils. The plant features heart-shaped, glossy leaves that are often tinged with yellow or gold, giving it its common name. It produces small, greenish-white flowers followed by bright red berries that are edible. Cissus chrysadenia is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and easy care requirements.
